title: Round function
summary: In topology and in calculus,  a round function is a scalar function M â†’ R {\displaystyle M\to {\mathbb {R} }} , over a manifold M {\displaystyle M} , whose critical points form one or several connected components, each homeomorphic to the circle S 1 {\displaystyle S^{1}} , also called critical loops. They are special cases of Morse-Bott functions.
